channel.title: Displaying an interface with the stats of another player

item.title: Displaying an interface with the stats of another player
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

your command is horrible, no offense. for one, there’s no need to loop through the max_players, but rather the actual players that are online.
two, you shouldn’t initialize and object until after all the checks are performed (null check, username, etc)

the command I posted was written more efficiently, and will be better off to use.
as for the the addChar method, you will need to stream the playerId to the client in the command itself, generally creating a new packet/reading it client sided.

Read full topic
item.source: Displaying an interface with the stats of another player

item.title: Displaying an interface with the stats of another player
item.dc:creator: @x1_att_ftw_x x1 att ftw x
item.description:
@x1_att_ftw_x wrote:

im done with the command.

if (playerCommand.startsWith("checkprof")) { String[] args = playerCommand.split(" "); for(int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) { Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[i]; if(Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(args[1])) { c.getPA().sendFrame200(26101, 9847);//chatid c.getPA().sendFrame185(26101); c.getPA().sendFrame126("@or1@Kills: @gre@"+c2.KC+"", 45112); c.getPA().sendFrame126("@or1@Deaths: @gre@"+c2.DC+"", 45113); c.getPA().sendFrame126("@or1@Name: @gre@"+Misc.optimizeText(c2.playerName)+"", 45116); c.getPA().sendFrame126("@or1@Name: @gre@"+Misc.optimizeText(c2.playerName)+"", 45109); c.getPA().sendFrame126("Cmb LvL: @gre@"+c2.combatLevel+"", 45114); c.getPA().sendFrame126("Pk Points: @gre@"+c2.pcPoints+"", 45115); c.getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@"+c2.thumbsUp+"", 45119); c.getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@"+c2.thumbsDown+"", 45120); if (c.playerRights == 1) { c.getPA().sendFrame126("@or1@Rank: @gre@Moderator", 45117); } if (c.playerRights == 2) { c.getPA().sendFrame126("@or1@Rank: @gre@Admin", 45117); } if (c.playerRights == 3) { c.getPA().sendFrame126("@or1@Rank: @gre@Owner", 45117); } if (c.playerRights == 0) { c.getPA().sendFrame126("@or1@Rank: @gre@Player", 45117); } c.getPA().showInterface(45106); break; } } } }

Rsinterface:

[code=java5]
public static void Profiles(TextDrawingArea[] TDA)
{
RSInterface localRSInterface1 = addTabInterface(45106);
RSInterface localRSInterface2 = addTabInterface(45133);
addSprite(45107, 7, “profile/CUSTOM”);
addText(45108, " Player Information", TDA, 0, 16746752, false, true);
addText(45109, " Test", TDA, 0, 16746752, false, true);
addText(45111, “Time Online”, TDA, 0, 14983494, false, true);
addText(45112, “Kills:”, TDA, 1, 16746752, false, true);
addText(45113, “Deaths:”, TDA, 1, 16746752, false, true);
addText(45114, “Combat:”, TDA, 1, 16746752, false, true);
addText(45115, “Pk Points::”, TDA, 1, 16746752, false, true);
addText(45116, “Name:”, TDA, 1, 16746752, false, true);
addText(45117, “Title:”, TDA, 1, 16746752, false, true);
addText(45118, “0”, TDA, 1, 16746752, false, true);
addText(45119, “0”, TDA, 1, 16746752, false, true);
addText(45120, “0”, TDA, 1, 16746752, false, true);

addHover(45121, 3, 0, 3826, 1, "Shop/CLOSE", 17, 17, "Close Window");
addHovered(3826, 2, "Shop/CLOSE", 17, 17, 3827);
addText(45122, "", TDA, 1, 16746752, false, true);
addChar(15125);

localRSInterface1.totalChildren(17);
localRSInterface1.child(0, 45107, 4, 16);
localRSInterface1.child(14, 45108, 342, 49);
localRSInterface1.child(16, 45109, 300, 79);
localRSInterface1.child(1, 45111, 176, 60);
localRSInterface1.child(2, 45112, 176, 106);
localRSInterface1.child(3, 45113, 176, 151);
localRSInterface1.child(4, 45114, 176, 197);
localRSInterface1.child(5, 45115, 176, 243);
localRSInterface1.child(6, 45116, 27, 288);
localRSInterface1.child(7, 45117, 157, 288);
localRSInterface1.child(8, 45118, 313, 281);
localRSInterface1.child(9, 45119, 405, 281);
localRSInterface1.child(10, 45120, 450, 281);
localRSInterface1.child(11, 45121, 483, 22);
localRSInterface1.child(12, 3826, 483, 22);
localRSInterface1.child(13, 45133, 295, 75);
localRSInterface1.child(15, 15125, 2, 170);

for (int i = 45134; i <= 45167; i++) {
addClickableText(i, “” + i, “Show”, TDA, 0, 16711680, false, true, 150);
}

// localRSInterface2.totalChildren(31);
// localRSInterface2.child(0, 45122, 319, 45);

localRSInterface2.width = 173;
localRSInterface2.height = 150;
localRSInterface2.scrollMax = 420;

}[/code]
add char adds My Character in the designated Section
i need it to add the other players character in the designated.
Sadly, i dont have a method for that, and i have no clue on how to go about this.

Also, Add char method is client sided.
the character is being pulled client sided.

item.title: Displaying an interface with the stats of another player
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

[code=java]if (playerCommand.startsWith(“prof”)) {
String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");

String player;

for (int i = 0; i < args.length; i++) {
    player = args[i] + " ".trim();
}

for (Player p : PlayerHandler.players) {
    if (p != null) {
        if (p.properName.equalsIgnoreCase(player)) {
            Client n = (Client)p;
        }
    }
}

c.getPA().showInterface(45106);
c.getPA().sendFrame126("@or1@Name: @gre@"+ n.properName, 45116);
//addChar(n.playerId);
c.flushOutStream();

}[/code]??

item.title: Displaying an interface with the stats of another player
item.dc:creator: @x1_att_ftw_x x1 att ftw x
item.description:
@x1_att_ftw_x wrote:

This will display the player writing the commands char.
not the other player.

public static void addChar(int ID) { RSInterface t = interfaceCache[ID] = new RSInterface(); t.id = ID; t.parentID = ID; t.type = 6; t.atActionType = 0; t.contentType = 328; t.width = 136; t.height = 168; t.opacity = 0; t.mOverInterToTrigger = 0; t.modelZoom = 560; t.modelRotation1 = 150; t.modelRotation2 = 0; t.anInt257 = -1; t.anInt258 = -1; }

Should i release the final product?
the plan is to make player be able to judge other players based on their behavior/performance in game.
For example you can see the star, thumbs up, and thumbs down.
This shows players who they can trust or not trust or which player is popular in the game.

item.title: Displaying an interface with the stats of another player
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

		if (playerCommand.startsWith("checkprof")) {
			try{
				String playerTwo = Integer.parseInt(playerCommand.split(" ")[1]);
				for (Player client : PlayerHandler.players) {
					if(client.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(playerTwo)){
					Player c2 = client;
					if (c2 != null) {
						c.getPA().sendFrame200(26101, 9847);//chatid
						c.getPA().sendFrame185(26101);
						c.getPA().sendFrame126("@or1@Kills: @gre@"+c2.KC+"", 45112);
						c.getPA().sendFrame126("@or1@Deaths: @gre@"+c2.DC+"", 45113);
						c.getPA().sendFrame126("@or1@Name: @gre@"+c2.playerName+"", 45116);
						c.getPA().sendFrame126("Cmb LvL: @gre@"+c2.combatLevel+"", 45114);
						c.getPA().sendFrame126("Pk Points: @gre@"+c2.pcPoints+"", 45115);
						c.getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@"+c2.thumbsUp+"", 45119);
						c.getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@"+c2.thumbsDown+"", 45120);
						c.getPA().showInterface(45106);
					}
				}
			}catch(Exception e){
				c.sendMessage("Use as| ::checkprof PlayerName");
			}
		}

Use that as a single command, forget PlayerAssistant

Read full topic

[code=java]if (playerCommand.startsWith(“prof”)) {
String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");

String player;

for (int i = 0; i < args.length; i++) {
    player = args[i] + " ".trim();
}

for (Player p : PlayerHandler.players) {
    if (p != null) {
        if (p.properName.equalsIgnoreCase(player)) {
            Client n = (Client)p;
        }
    }
}

c.getPA().showInterface(45106);
c.getPA().sendFrame126("@or1@Name: @gre@"+ n.properName, 45116);
c.flushOutStream();

}[/code]wrote this on my phone; may have errors[/quote]

item.title: Displaying an interface with the stats of another player
item.dc:creator: @Null_Amount N_A
item.description:
@Null_Amount wrote:

Try this:[code=java]public void getPlayerStats(String otherPlayer) {
try {
for (Player p : PlayerHandler.players) {
Client otherPlayer = (Client) p;
getPA().sendFrame200(26101, 9847);
getPA().sendFrame185(26101);
getPA().sendFrame126("@or1@Kills: @gre@" + p.KC + “”, 45112);
getPA().sendFrame126("@or1@Deaths: @gre@" + p.DC + “”, 45113);
getPA().sendFrame126("@or1@Name: @gre@" + p.playerName + “”, 45116);
getPA().sendFrame126("@or1@CB Level: @gre@" + p.combatLevel + “”, 45114);
getPA().sendFrame126("@or1@PK Points: @gre@" + p.pcPoints + “”, 45115);
getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@" + p.thumbsUp + “”, 45119);
getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@" + p.thumbsDown + “”, 45120);
getPA().showInterface(45106);
}
}
}

if (command.startsWith(“checkprof”)) {
try {
String[] args = command.split(" ");
String otherName = args[1];
if (args.length < 1) {
c.sendMessage(“Syntax is ::checkprof-name”);
}
c.getPlayerStats(otherName);
}
}[/code]

item.title: Displaying an interface with the stats of another player
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

You want to make the command split (Usually by a space, or something similar).
Then you want to send the second players name to the stat checker.
Also, I did not mean to make it getPlayerPlayerStats, I meant getPlayerStats, sorry.

if (playerCommand.startsWith("checkprof")) { try{ String playerName = Integer.parseInt(playerCommand.split(" ")[1]); c.getPlayerStats(playerName); }catch(Exception e){ c.sendMessage("Use as| ::checkprof PlayerName"); } }

Read full topic

item.title: Displaying an interface with the stats of another player
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Player Assistant.java:

	public void getPlayerPlayerStats(String playerName){
		for (Player client : PlayerHandler.players) {
			if(client.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(playerName)){
				Player c2 = client;
				if (c2 != null) {
	                sendFrame200(26101, 9847);//chatid
	                sendFrame185(26101);
	                sendFrame126("@or1@Kills: @gre@"+c2.KC+"", 45112);
	                sendFrame126("@or1@Deaths: @gre@"+c2.DC+"", 45113);
	                sendFrame126("@or1@Name: @gre@"+c2.playerName+"", 45116);
	                sendFrame126("Cmb LvL: @gre@"+c2.combatLevel+"", 45114);
	                sendFrame126("Pk Points: @gre@"+c2.pcPoints+"", 45115);
	                sendFrame126("@gre@"+c2.thumbsUp+"", 45119);
	                sendFrame126("@gre@"+c2.thumbsDown+"", 45120);
	                showInterface(45106);
				}
			}
		}
	}

Read full topic

item.title: Displaying an interface with the stats of another player

item.description:
@x1_att_ftw_x wrote:

if (playerCommand.startsWith("checkprofile")) { try { String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ", 2); for(int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) { Client c2 = null; c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[i]; c.getPA().showInterface(45106); c.getPA().sendFrame126("@or1@Name: @gre@"+ c2.playerName, 45116); c.flushOutStream(); } } catch(Exception e) { c.sendMessage("Player Must Be Offline."); } }
This is what i have, it shows me the interface, but it doesnt show the other players name in the designated area. only mine.
